xccdf:Benchmark.xccdf:title: XCCDF Benchmark That References the Validation Content for the lockoutpolicy_test

xccdf:Profile.xccdf:title: XCCDF Profile That References the Validation Content for the lockoutpolicy_test

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Test the force_logoff entity with the greater than operation
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: Make sure the force_logoff entity properly supports the greater than operation.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: Make sure the force_logoff entity properly supports the equals operation.

metadata.title: Test the force_logoff entity with the greater than operation
metadata.description: Make sure the force_logoff entity properly supports the greater than operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the force_logoff is greater than 0 seconds.

metadata.title: Test the force_logoff entity with the equals operation
metadata.description: Make sure the force_logoff entity properly supports the equals operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the force_logoff equals 3600 seconds.

metadata.title: Test the force_logoff entity with the less than operation
metadata.description: Make sure the force_logoff entity properly supports the less than operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the force_logoff is less than 4294967295 seconds (TIMEQ_FOREVER).

metadata.title: Test the force_logoff entity with the less than or equal operation
metadata.description: Make sure the force_logoff entity properly supports the less than or equal operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the force_logoff is less than or equal to 3600 seconds.

metadata.title: Test the force_logoff entity with the greater than or equal operation
metadata.description: Make sure the force_logoff entity properly supports the greater than or equal operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the force_logoff is greater than or equal to 3600 seconds.

metadata.title: Test the lockout_duration entity with the greater than operation
metadata.description: Make sure the lockout_duration entity properly supports the greater than operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the lockout_duration is greater than 0 seconds.

metadata.title: Test the lockout_duration entity with the equals operation
metadata.description: Make sure the lockout_duration entity properly supports the equals operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the lockout_duration equals 60 seconds.

metadata.title: Test the lockout_duration entity with the less than or equal operation
metadata.description: Make sure the lockout_duration entity properly supports the less than or equal operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the lockout_duration is less than or equal to 60 seconds.

metadata.title: Test the lockout_duration entity with the greater than or equal operation
metadata.description: Make sure the lockout_duration entity properly supports the greater than or equal operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the lockout_duration is greater than or equal to 60 seconds.

metadata.title: Test the lockout_duration entity with the less than operation
metadata.description: Make sure the lockout_duration entity properly supports the less than operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the lockout_duration is less than 0 seconds.

metadata.title: Test the lockout_observation_window entity with the greater than operation
metadata.description: Make sure the lockout_observation_window entity properly supports the greater than operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the lockout_observation_window is greater than 1 second.

metadata.title: Test the lockout_observation_window entity with the equals operation
metadata.description: Make sure the lockout_observation_window entity properly supports the equals operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the lockout_observation_window equals 120 seconds.

metadata.title: Test the lockout_observation_window entity with the less than or equal operation
metadata.description: Make sure the lockout_observation_window entity properly supports the less than or equal operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the lockout_observation_window is less than or equal to 120 seconds.

metadata.title: Test the lockout_observation_window entity with the greater than or equal operation
metadata.description: Make sure the lockout_observation_window entity properly supports the greater than or equal operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the lockout_observation_window is greater than or equal to 120 seconds.

metadata.title: Test the lockout_observation_window entity with the less than operation
metadata.description: Make sure the lockout_observation_window entity properly supports the less than operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the lockout_observation_window is less than 0 seconds.

metadata.title: Test the lockout_threshold entity with the greater than operation
metadata.description: Make sure the lockout_threshold entity properly supports the greater than operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the lockout_threshold is greater than 0 seconds.

metadata.title: Test the lockout_threshold entity with the equals operation
metadata.description: Make sure the lockout_threshold entity properly supports the equals operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the lockout_threshold equals 10 seconds.

metadata.title: Test the lockout_threshold entity with the greater than or equal operation
metadata.description: Make sure the lockout_threshold entity properly supports the greater than or equal operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the lockout_threshold is greater than or equal to 10 seconds.

metadata.title: Test the lockout_threshold entity with the less than or equal operation
metadata.description: Make sure the lockout_threshold entity properly supports the less than or equal operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the lockout_threshold is less than or equal to 10 seconds.

metadata.title: Test the lockout_threshold entity with the less than operation
metadata.description: Make sure the lockout_threshold entity properly supports the less than operation.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the lockout_threshold is less than 0 seconds.

metadata.title: Test the criterion construct with the negate property
metadata.description: Make sure that the criterion construct properly supports the negate property.

criterion.comment: Test to see that the lockout_observation_window is greater than or equal to 120 seconds.

lockoutpolicy_test.comment: Test to see that the force_logoff is greater than 0 seconds.
Test to see that the force_logoff equals 3600 seconds.
Test to see that the force_logoff is less than 4294967295 seconds (TIMEQ_FOREVER).
Test to see that the force_logoff is less than or equal to 3600 seconds.
Test to see that the force_logoff is greater than or equal to 3600 seconds.
Test to see that the lockout_duration is greater than 0 seconds.
Test to see that the lockout_duration equals 60 seconds.
Test to see that the lockout_duration is less than or equal to 60 seconds.
Test to see that the lockout_duration is greater than or equal to 60 seconds.
Test to see that the lockout_duration is less than 0 seconds.
Test to see that the lockout_observation_window is greater than 1 second.
Test to see that the lockout_observation_window equals 120 seconds.
Test to see that the lockout_observation_window is less than or equal to 120 seconds.
Test to see that the lockout_observation_window is greater than or equal to 120 seconds.
Test to see that the lockout_observation_window is less than 0 seconds.
Test to see that the lockout_threshold is greater than 0 seconds.
Test to see that the lockout_threshold equals 10 seconds.
Test to see that the lockout_threshold is greater than or equal to 10 seconds.
Test to see that the lockout_threshold is less than or equal to 10 seconds.
Test to see that the lockout_threshold is less than 0 seconds.

generator.oval:product_name: National Institute of Standards and Technology

metadata.title: Microsoft Windows is installed
metadata.description: The operating system installed on the system is Microsoft Windows

criterion.comment: the installed operating system is part of the Microsoft Windows family

family_test.comment: the installed operating system is part of the Microsoft Windows family

family_object.comment: This is the default family object. Only one family object should exist.

notes.note: This CPE Name represents the Windows OS
